segments.en: “Mendicants, there are these four kinds of overflowing merit, overflowing goodness that nurture happiness.

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako buddhe aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti—
segments.en: It’s when a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Buddha …

segments.pli: itipi so bhagavā … pe … satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavāti.
Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako dhamme … pe …
Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako vigatamalamaccherena cetasā agāraṃ ajjhāvasati muttacāgo payatapāṇi vossaggarato yācayogo dānasaṃvibhāgarato.
segments.en: Furthermore, a noble disciple lives at home rid of the stain of stinginess, freely generous, open-handed, loving to let go, committed to charity, loving to give and to share.
This is the fourth kind of overflowing merit, overflowing goodness that nurtures happiness.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro puññābhisandā kusalābhisandā sukhassāhārā”ti.
segments.en: These are the four kinds of overflowing merit, overflowing goodness that nurture happiness.”

sections.title: “Mendicants, there are these four kinds of overflowing merit,…

suttaplex.blurb: The four factors of stream-entry—with generosity as the fourth—are streams of merit.
